doc.field: Brooklyn Society of the New Church property records
Brooklyn Society of the New Church property records

Records relating to the Brooklyn Society of the New Church's purchase of property at Clark and Monroe Streets, including subscription lists, minutes, mortgages, receipts, and correspondence. Documents span the period 1868 to 1926.

Records relating to the Brooklyn Society of the New Church's purchase of property at Clark and Monroe Streets, including subscription lists, minutes, mortgages, receipts, and correspondence. Documents span the period 1868 to 1926.
Brooklyn Society of the New Church
Brooklyn Society of the New Church
Brooklyn Society of the New Church

Records relating to the Brooklyn Society of the New Church's purchase of property at Clark and Monroe Streets, including subscription lists, minutes, mortgages, receipts, and correspondence. Documents span the period 1868 to 1926.

The Brooklyn Society of the New Church was a Swedenborgian church organized in the 1850s. In 1869, the church purchased land at Clark and Monroe Streets that had formerly belonged to the Universalist Church of the Restoration.
